Carousel Columbia is famed for its beauty and handcrafted details.🎠

Providing an incredible grand entrance to Great America, Carousel Columbia has been the focal point for all entering the park since 1976 and is the tallest carousel in the world. In total, this legacy ride includes dozens of jumping horses, six standing horses, three chariots, a camel, a giraffe, a lion, a tiger, a dragon, a deer, a seahorse, and pairs of jumping ostriches, pigs, cats and rabbits. 

To maintain Carousel Columbia's beauty, our team has began restoration on the 2nd tier while six to ten animal figures are renewed at a time. The process will take place over the next year in order to keep the ride operating.

What's your go-to carousel animal to take a spin on?

ICYMI: Yesterday, the United States Air Force celebrated 100 years of aerial refueling by executing flyovers of their air refuelers above communities across the country. A KC-135 Stratotanker aircraft from MacDill Air Force Base in Fla. and a C-17 Globemaster III aircraft from Charleston Air Force Base in S.C. were even visible throughout the southeast region of the U.S. with the last point of contact for active refueling being above Busch Gardens Tampa Bay! ✈

We are proud to celebrate and honors members of the military with our newly launched Busch Gardens & Adventure Island Tampa Bay 2023 Military Pass, which includes unlimited visits for active-duty military through the rest of 2023. To learn more, visit: https://bit.ly/432Nnrq

Conservation success story: Bison were almost hunted to extinction in the late 1800’s as settlers moved across North America. They were hunted for their hides, as a food source, and to clear the land for colonization. Marineland and other zoological facilities have helped restore the population, and there are now over 150,000 Bison in Canada!

We know the weather can be unpredictable, especially during the summer. That's why Quassy has a Sunshine Guarantee so you can ensure you and your family make the most of your time at the park and can continue making lasting memories at Quassy throughout the season! Through this policy, if the park announces that it must close prior to 7 p.m. due to rain, lightning, or any other force of nature, guests get a rain pass to come back for more fun on another day. 

Passes are given as follows at the time of Park closure:

* If the Park closes before 4 p.m. A guest will receive an All-Day Rain Pass valid for the ticket type purchased.
* If the Park closes After 4 p.m. A guest will receive an After 4 p.m. Pass regardless of your ticket type purchased.
* If you purchased a weekday ticket, the Rain Pass will only be valid for a weekday return.  
* If you purchased a weekend ticket, the Rain Pass will be valid any day.
* Rain Passes will NOT be given after 7 p.m. and are NOT valid on July 4th.

Don't let the weather ruin your plans! There are always sunnier days ahead! 

Read our full Sunshine Guarantee on our website here: https://bit.ly/44g8ozZ

As the national bird of the United States, bald eagles are a big deal. So it’s natural that their feathers would be too. That’s why when Star sheds any feathers, we collect and send them to the National Eagle Repository. This Repository was created to ensure Native Americans have access to feathers for religious and cultural purposes.

Are the penguins at Marineland South African Penguins? They are actually Magellanic penguins and do look similar! Magellanic penguins are known as banded penguins, and they are one of four species – their relatives are the African penguin, Humbold penguin, and the Galapagos penguin.  They stand out from the others as they have two bands across the top of their breast bone.

Happy #WorldPinkFlamingoDay! 🦩 Flamingos live an average of 20-30 years, with some living up to 50 years. The Andean highland flamingo, native to the Andes mountain of South America, is one of the rarest flamingo species and is an AZA SAFE animal, meaning AZA member organizations are working together to help save these animals from extinction. Visit www.aza.org/safe-species to learn more! #AZASAFE #WeAreAZA #SavingSpecies

Yesterday, California's Great America participated in the annual World's Largest Swimming Lesson! We had an amazing turnout at South Bay Shores Waterpark, making waves as part of this global initiative to spread awareness about the importance of learning to swim. 🏊‍♂️ #WLSL #WLSL2023

The World’s Largest Swimming Lesson

If we wouldn’t eat it, they shouldn’t eat it. That means the animals in our care receive meals made only from human-grade, sustainably sourced ingredients. Each animal’s personalized diet is planned and approved by a veterinarian, no matter how big or small they may be.

Today, we are honored to welcome Give Kids The World to the park!

Give Kids The World is a nonprofit organization that provides critically ill children and their families week-long, cost-free wish vacations in Central Florida. Their visit to Six Flags Great America is part of their 2023 Summer Road Trip, where alumni wish families are given the chance to reconnect, reminisce, and promote camaraderie among families with shared experiences.

It's National Pollinator Week! 🐝 Why are pollinators important? Pollinators help grow more than 1,200 food crops and 180,00 different types of plants which help feed us, stabilize our soils, clean our air, supply us oxygen, support wildlife and contribute billions of dollars to our economy 🌻 Stay tune to learn more about how you can help. You can also learn more at https://www.nps.gov/subjects/pollinators/index.htm

​

THEN vs. NOW! ⁠
⁠
The iconic BumbleBee Ride from the original Santa's Village utilized the 45ft tall steel monorail track that, until recently, had been left unused. SkyPark has been engineering a one-of-a-kind thrill ride named the 'B-Rail' as an homage to the original. Once we receive final sign-off from OSHA, we will offer our guests an exciting tour of the park atop a suspended, self-powered bicycle that follows the original journey of the BumbleBee monorail. ⁠
⁠
We're so excited to offer this new attraction very soon that perfectly blends SkyPark BikePark and SkyPark Santa's Village while honoring the original attraction. ⁠
⁠
Sky Park is growing and expanding everyday, but we've made it our mission to honor what the park has meant to people for many years. We love receiving photos from our community of photos from past iterations of the park. Do you have any old photos from the old Santa's Village you'd like to share? Send us a DM and you could be featured on our social channels.⁠
⁠
B Rail: Coming very soon!

June is Zoo and Aquarium Month! Marineland is proud to offer the opportunity to learn about marine and terrestrial mammals, and be inspired to make a difference for their wild counterparts. Zoos and aquariums help foster a love for animals, and sparks a desire to do more for animals and our planet. This month, we encourage you to come visit us and our animals, and support your local zoological facility!

#DidYouKnow? Meerkats have a unique system of sentinels to protect their group! 🚨👀

These vigilant sentinels have keen eyesight and are always on high alert, ready to give a warning call if they detect any danger, such as predators or approaching humans. It's a remarkable display of teamwork.

Next time you spot one of our meerkats standing tall and keeping watch, remember the important role they play in their fascinating social structure. They truly embody the saying 'safety in numbers'! 🌍🌿 #DYK #MeerkatFacts

The path on the Invertigo roller coaster is twisted: Up a 138-foot hill for a downhill launch at 55 mph, into a 72-foot loop, into a twist, into another loop and then another loop. Then, up a second hill, a second launch and the trip is repeated. Backward. By the time it's over, riders have been upside down six times on the one-minute, 30-second ride. Share if you are among the more than 13 million guests that have experienced a ride on this attraction since it debuted in 1999. #KingsIsland

Seniors are taking over Happy Hollow tomorrow, Thursday, June 22! 🐲 At Senior Safari, presented by Kaiser Permanente, adults 50+ can enjoy free admission and parking, early entry to the park and zoo, and fun activities! Join in on the fun on Thursday, June 22 from 9-10 a.m. Please note that Senior Safari guests must arrive before 10 a.m. to receive free parking and admission.

If you haven't already registered for a Senior Safari passport, plan to arrive a little early to complete the registration process without delaying any of the fun! Visit https://happyhollow.org/seniorsafari/ to learn more.

Senior Safari is a joint program of Happy Hollow Foundation and Happy Hollow Park & Zoo.

Did you know? While thought to be only found in cold water environments, Belugas have been seen living in water that reaches a temperature of 16º Celsius. Sometimes pods of belugas will visit as far south as Cape Cod! They primarily live around Alaska, Canada, Russia, Norway, and Greenland.

Start your Tuesday with a sea lion fun fact! Sea lions are adapted for movement on land as well as in the water. Their wing-like front flippers have a bone structure similar to that in our arms and hands! Come by Pacific Point Preserve during your next visit to learn more about sea lions.

It's National Pollinator Week! 🦋 Pollinators are insects and animals that help move pollen from one plant to another. More than 80% of flowering plants need pollinators to help them reproduce by the transfer of pollen 🌻 Stay tuned this week for interesting facts and how you can help. You can also learn more at https://www.nps.gov/subjects/pollinators/index.htm

Melanin Coaster Network  is a roller coaster club dedicated to highlighting people of color and is led by the motto 'bridging the gap by bringing people together.'

Six Flags Over Georgia celebrates Juneteenth in an ongoing effort towards racial equality.

At Happy Hollow, Veterinary Technician Rachel makes sure that all the animals have the care they need: from yearly checkups to daily medications. Happy Hollow's veterinary care team also includes local veterinarians who help care for our animals based on their specializations. Today, on #VeterinaryAppreciationDay, we say thank you, Rachel and team! Here you can see Rachel and team completing Xena the giant anteater's yearly check up. Extra thanks to the Happy Hollow Foundation for supporting veterinary efforts by providing the warming blanket that Xena laid on during her procedure.

This Father's Day, we are thrilled to announce the arrival of our newest baby lemur, Fizz! 💙 Born to Ginger (mom) and Spike (dad), Fizz currently weighs less than 1/2 pound and is growing every day. Next time you're here at Busch Gardens, be sure to stop by The Edge Of Africa and give a warm welcome the new little guy!

Fun Fact: Although it is not typical for male lemurs to parent or assist in raising babies, Spike is a very attentive and nurturing dad. He will check in on mom and baby often and come running when the baby makes sounds. Spike chooses to spend his time close to Ginger and Fizz and can be seen grooming both of them daily. We think that makes his extra special and pretty amazing!

Happy World Sea Turtle Day! Did you know our team works all year round to ensure the wellbeing of Honu (Hawaiian green sea turtles) and the health of our reef ecosystems through the park's conservation programs and partnerships? 
 
To date, our park has released over 17,000 honu hatchlings from our Honu Conservation program into the ocean. Together with our educational outreach and the collective efforts of like-minded organizations and community members, we're contributing to the resurgence of Hawaii's Honu population. Learn more about Honu and their vital role in the marine environment during the park's daily Honu Talks, located at their habitat!

Researchers classify different populations of belugas as a “stock”. Different stocks can have multiple groups, or pods, of belugas! Different stocks are still mostly the same as other belugas, but their genetics, behaviour and hunting patterns will be different depending on their stock location. They are diverse just like us as we live all over the world and have different lifestyles!

Happy #WorldSeaTurtleDay! The #AZASAFE Sea Turtle 🐢 program is working on supporting efforts to secure sustainable populations of some of the most critically endangered species of sea turtles, the Kemp's ridley and the Eastern Pacific leatherback. You can help by reducing your use of plastic products like straws and other single use items. Visit www.aza.org/safe-species to learn more! #WeAreAZA #SavingSpecies

The weather is getting hotter! It is important to have a plan to keep yourself safe from heat-related illnesses. Make sure that you drink plenty of water, wear light clothing, wear a hat, put on sunscreen and take breaks out of the sun. Check on your friends and family and have someone do the same for you. Watch out for these signs and take immediate action to help prevent further illness ☀️👒💦🧑‍🤝‍🧑

Arrow is having a Birthday Party and You're invited!⁠
Our beloved mascot deserves not one, but two whole days of celebration! Join us June 24th and 25th for a weekend of birthday fun! 🎉⁠
⁠
WHO IS ARROW?⁠
Arrow the dog is the Guardian of the NorthWoods and Santa’s most trusted companion.⁠
⁠
Long ago, on a foggy and blustery Christmas Eve, Arrow was roaming the NorthWoods when he saw a bright flash of light and a strange object falling from the sky. Rushing to investigate, Arrow noticed a man with a jolly laugh and the sound of bells coming from the object.⁠
⁠
“What is your name, pup?” Santa asked.⁠
⁠
“Arroooooooow!” howled the excited dog.⁠
⁠
Santa instantly fell in love with the dog and brought him home to Santa’s Village.⁠
⁠
Arrow is easily the most beloved creature in all of Santa’s Village, which is probably why you can find monuments of him wherever you travel in the NorthWoods. No one in the village can resist his friendly demeanor and kind little soul. He absolutely loves greeting guests and making new friends.

No mês de abril o Playland participou da 14ª edição do DNA - Dia Nacional da Alegria, que proporcionou um dia de muita alegria e diversão para centenas de crianças e jovens assistidos por ONG's e Instituições Sociais.

A iniciativa acontece todos os anos e é promovida pelo SINDEPAT (Sistema Integrado de Parques e Atrações) com o apoio da ADIBRA (Associação dos Parques e Atrações do Brasil).

Em 2023 recebemos no DNA aproximadamente 1.000 convidados, que puderam se divertir de montão nos Playlands: Grand Plaza, Center Norte, Eldorado, Interlagos,  Osasco e também no Playcenter Family! 💙

Já estamos ansiosos pela próxima edição! 😊

Carrossel ou Auto Pista? 🤔

Carrossel 🎠
Um passeio a bordo de cavalinhos que giram e giram ao som de música instrumental e de um visual encantador, repleto de luzes e cores que enchem os olhos!

Auto Pista 🚘
Aperte os cintos e divirta-se pilotando carrinhos de variadas cores sem se preocupar com as batidas! (Se bater a brincadeira fica ainda mais legal).

Essas duas atrações fazem muito sucesso entre as crianças! Que tal chamar os pequenos para vir brincar no Play!? 😁

- A atração 'Carrossel' está disponível em todas as nossas unidades! Já a Auto Pista faz a alegria da garotada em todos os Playlands, exceto: Eldorado e Tatuapé.

- Confira na entrada da atração a altura para acesso e as demais restrições e orientações de segurança. 🤓

Happy 5th Birthday RailBlazer!🎢🎈
 
The design of the ride evokes images of an off-road, ATV adventure with immersive theming that embraces the great outdoors of the Bay Area and Central California Coast. RailBlazer lifts riders to a height of 106 feet before dropping at a breathtaking 90-degree angle. Throughout the 1,800 feet of track, riders travel 52 mph, experience an abundance of airtime and steeply banked turns, undertake 3 inversions and twist through a zero-gravity roll. The tight footprint of the ride itself intensifies every twist and turn.

#CAGreatAmerica

Enjoy a hosted dinner and a movie the night of your stay and wake up to a delicious breakfast the next morning 🥞. After, head into the park to have some fun and come back for a tasty lunch! 

Click here to learn more about this event: gilroygardens.org/stay/park-camp-nights

It's that time again! Next week, seniors are taking over Happy Hollow 🐲 At Senior Safari, presented by Kaiser Permanente, adults 50+ can enjoy free admission and parking, early entry to the park and zoo, and fun activities! Mark your calendars and join in on the fun on Thursday, June 22 from 9-10 a.m. Please note that Senior Safari guests must arrive before 10 a.m. to receive free parking and admission.

If you haven't already registered for a Senior Safari passport, plan to arrive a little early to complete the registration process without delaying any of the fun! Visit https://happyhollow.org/seniorsafari/ to learn more.

Senior Safari is a joint program of Happy Hollow Foundation and Happy Hollow Park & Zoo.

Did you know? Most penguin species are actually found living in temperate or warmer climates, like the Magellanic penguin! Of the 18 species of penguins, only four can be found living in colder climates around Antarctica!

The SeaWorld Coral Rescue Center officially opens this afternoon! In partnership with the Fish & Wildlife Foundation of Florida, SeaWorld’s Coral Rescue Center aims to address the urgent need to protect and repopulate these corals, which are susceptible to the devastating Stony Coral Tissue Loss Disease. Come by the Coral Rescue Center during your next visit to observe and interact with biologists working to repopulate the Florida Reef Tract!

It's nesting season for our feathered friends who call SkyPark their home! Whether it's a safe place high from predators, low and covered in vegetation or tucked away in a natural hole in a tree, our resident ducks, steller's jays, western bluebirds and more are hard at work. 🦆

Eggs are typically laid between mid-March and end of July. If you see a nest, remember to leave it be. As the weather continues to warm up, we look forward to seeing all the ducklings and chicks around the park very soon! 🐥

Coasting for Kids is an event that features an exclusive ride time, lunch, and admission to the park for anyone who signs up and raises $100 for Give Kids The World Village. 

Give Kids The World Village is an 89-acre, whimsical nonprofit resort in Central Florida that provides critically ill children and their families from around the world with a magical week-long wish vacation at no cost.

Today, on World Oceans Day, we are taking a moment to reflect on our company mission. For 60 years, that mission has been to preserve and protect our world’s oceans. We embody this every day by advancing marine conservation both in and outside our parks through science, rescue, education and exceptional animal care. With over 40,000 rescues and counting, more than 400 peer reviewed scientific articles and books published, and more than $20 million dollars in grants given to 1,400 organizations across the world, we are proud of the meaningful contributions we have made (with the support of our fans and guests) to help conserve marine life for future generations. bit.ly/45VBJBe

We celebrate World Oceans Day every day at SeaWorld, because the ocean is fundamental to the work we do. For 60 years, SeaWorld has helped preserve the world’s oceans and protect the extraordinary animals that live in them.​

​Every day, we advance marine conservation in and outside our parks through science, education, and exceptional animal care. A portion of your ticket and in park purchases goes toward funding our animal rescue and conservation work every day, so your visit is one you should feel proud of! ​

​🌎🌊

FUN FACT: Did you know the original Grand Pavilion lives inside our NEW Cedar Point Grand Pavilion? The stained-glass squares in this art piece were taken from the original Grand Pavilion from 1888. 

So basically… every day in the NEW Cedar Point Grand Pavilion is a #ThrowbackThursday!

On this World Oceans Day, we're especially thankful for YOU and your support. 🌎💙 Caring for the world's oceans and its extraordinary animals is at the core of our mission. To date, we've been able to rescue more than 40,000 animals, and are one of the world's largest marine animal rescue organizations. A portion of each ticket and in-park purchase goes toward funding our conservation work, so your visit is one you should feel proud of.
Want the perfect way to beat the heat? Come join us at our Lazy River today!

Let's wish a big happy 4th birthday to Betty! Betty is a Gemsbok, which is known for its incredible ability to survive in the desert. They can tolerate extreme temperatures and can go without water for long periods by extracting moisture from the plants they eat.🌵🦌

Be sure to stop by and see Betty this week on the Safari Train! 
📸: Savvy, ZooKeeper

We've got so many exciting events coming up this week at SkyPark, starting tomorrow!⁠
⁠
Thursday: ☕️Coffee with a Cop hosted by the Twin Peaks Sheriff's Station - Join us in welcoming local officers to Kringle's Coffee, Thursday June 8th, 8:30am-9:30am. @sbcsdtwinpeaks Free admission and a regular coffee to all attending for the event. (A DayPass must be purchased for guests staying at SkyPark after the event has ended)⁠
⁠
Thursday: Toddler Time continues! 🧸Our newest ticket enhancement to Thursday mornings continues this week with a Sensory Discovery Bin - Explore the rainbow in a fun-filled sensory bin at Santa's Workshop! ⁠
⁠
Friday: Tunes in the Trees! 🎸Our favorite Oingo Boingo tribute band, Dead Man's Party @deadmanspartyca - Tunes in the Trees is BACK for another fantastic show. The party theme is 'Dead' so come dressed in your best sugar skulls and 'dead man's' garb. Show starts at 7pm ⁠
⁠
Saturday: Bike Fest Begins! 🚵🏼It's about that time for our semi-annual Bike Fest. Join us all day Saturday and Sunday - full list of events here: 🍺Bike Fest Happy Hour is 4-6pm!⁠
⁠
Saturday Night: Saturday Skate Night! 🛼 It's not summer at SkyPark without our themed roller skating nights. This week, our theme is Heart of Rock and Roll, so stick around after bike fest for a wheelie good time! Saturday Skate Nights Party starts at 7pm!⁠
Hope to see you there!⁠
⁠
Want to see what summer events are coming soon? Check out our SkyPark Summer blog- link in bio!

We're jumping for joy over Toddler Time Thursdays! Our newest DayPass enhancement to Thursday mornings begins at 10:30am each week. This week (June 8th), our theme is 'Sensory Discovery' – Explore the rainbow in a fun-filled sensory bin at Santa's Workshop! ⁠
⁠
Doors open for Toddler Time at 9:00am so that parents can purchase coffee or breakfast at Kringle’s Coffee & Gifts before the fun starts if they like. Please note that parents must remain with their children and supervise them at all times. Toddler Time activities are guided and parental participation is encouraged! This expansion is made with Toddlers in mind and encouraged for ages 5 and under. (& ages 3 and under receive free park admittance!)⁠
⁠ 
More info here: https://www.facebook.com/events/202028989303479/208445098661868/?active_tab=about

RESCUE UPDATE: Remember Reckless – the mama manatee who came to us a year ago still nursing her calf after suffering a severe boat strike? We’re happy to share that mom and baby Churro are doing so much better! As the summer kicks off and more people are headed out on their boats, we hope Reckless and Churro’s story can serve as an important reminder to obey the boating laws and mind your speed in areas where manatees are known to frequent.

Activities conducted under USFWS Permit No. MA80925C

WEATHER ALERT: We will be OPEN today Sunday June 4th - due to the rain we will have a reduced admission of $20 for a ride wristband- we will operate as many of the rides for as long as we can, but the rain forecasted to last all day will impact our normal operations which is why we have reduced our ride cost. If all of the rides have to be closed for an extended period of time we will issue rain checks, but not refunds. No further discounts will be available on the already reduced price. If you are coming today be sure to have your rain gear and dress warm!

It is said that the Kuffel Orchard, nestled next to Lady Bug Pond on our Meadowlands Trail, was planted around 1890 when homesteaders settled the land. SkyPark has made it our mission to conserve this orchard by propagating and planting new trees to keep the orchard thriving. ⁠♻️🌳⁠

SkyPark promotes clean living, sustainability, and conservation in a fun and interactive exchange with the environment. It is not enough to tell children to conserve and protect the environment. We believe we must show them what practices that entails! ⁠

Want to learn more? Click here: https://skyparksantasvillage.com/media/media-kit/

On June 3rd, 1911, Walter Knott married Cordelia Hornaday in Pomona, California. The high school sweethearts eventually settled in Buena Park in 1920, where they would start a theme park filled with fried chicken and boysenberries. Happy 112th Anniversary to our founders! 💍

If you are coming today be sure to have your rain gear and dress warm!

At Barney Oldfield’s Redwood Rally, drivers are transported back in time with cars replicating the earliest roadsters on an extended track, passing by a dozen billboards and signage of California landmarks. Kids take the wheel (with little guidance from underneath), control the gas pedal, and take their parents for a drive. 🏁

As part of NorCal County Fair, CGA's newly renovated section of the park, this beloved attraction has had a retheming guests of all ages can appreciate. Create memories and share your experience by using #NorCalCountyFair

WEATHER ALERT: We are tracking inclement weather this weekend that could impact our ability to keep our rides open for the majority of the day both Saturday and Sunday (June 3rd and 4th). While a quick passing storm has a short term effect on our operations, storms forecasted to last all day can impact our ability to open the rides for a full day. Please keep this in mind if you are planning to visit this weekend and we will post closures by 9am in the morning if we believe that the rides will need to be closed for the day. 
If you are attending with a group this weekend be assured we are in communication with your group and update plans accordingly.

A - Aftershock or Avalanche Mtn
B - Bumper Boats or Boulder Beach Bay

Celebration Canada is coming soon, save the date for the country’s biggest birthday party! 🇨🇦 🎉 
 
From July 1 - 9, join the festivities and embrace everything that makes this country great with toe-tapping live music and bands and traditional indigenous performances by the Smoke Trail Singers. Plus, interactive games, mouth-watering Canadian foods, and specially themed beverages.

The Florida Reef Tract is facing a major threat with stony coral tissue loss disease (SCTLD). That’s why federal, state, and private organizations (like SeaWorld) have come together to save healthy corals from the diseased reef before the illness spreads further. At the Florida Coral Rescue Center, we house and gene-bank these healthy corals with the goal of spawning new baby corals that will eventually help replenish the reef. 

While there is no known cure for SCTLD,  there are other things you can do to help protect the reefs. Wear reef-safe sunscreen, pick up and throw away any foreign trash or debris, exhibit safe boating practices, and make sure you don’t touch the reef while diving.

DYK: 45% of parrot species worldwide are Near Threatened, Threatened, or Endangered. Threats include poaching for their characteristically colorful feathers or for the pet trade, and habitat loss from unsustainable farming practices. You can help protect parrots by choosing to purchase bird-safe or forest-safe products and products that commit to using sustainable palm oil. If you choose to get a parrot as a pet, make sure you have done your research and are able to provide an appropriate home to these animals with complex needs, and be sure your new pet comes from a responsible breeder rather than from wild sources. Learn more about parrots and how you can help them by visiting https://www.facebook.com/ParrotTAG.

✨ Meet Magician Extraordinaire Jim Sisti! ✨ Jim and his wife Sandy have been entertaining audiences at Quassy Amusement Park and Waterpark for the past 20 years. This year, Jim and Sandy return to the Carousel Theatre Stage for Quassy’s 115th Anniversary celebration with a brand new act featuring jaw-dropping illusions and hilarious comedy bits that will have audiences rolling on the floor laughing. Jim has been a full-time magician for the past 33 years. Aside from performing, Jim has written several books on magic and even conducts lectures for amateur magic groups around the country. Jim has also done consulting work, putting his two cents on major magic acts such as Criss Angel’s Mindfreak on A&E. But his home is always at Quassy during the summers. “We enjoy seeing families come back year after year to see the show,” Jim said. “We’re also very gratified by the way Quassy has embraced us as a part of the park family. When the season starts every year, it’s like a reunion.”

We've got some otter-ly wonderful news – we've welcomed a new rescued southern sea otter to Otter Outlook! Meet Chilly 🧊 ​

​Chilly was rescued in June 2021 by trained rescue personnel from the Monterey Bay Aquarium and CA Department of Fish and Wildlife, who found her with trauma associated with a fishing line entanglement. She was brought to Monterey Bay Aquarium for rehabilitation and was recently deemed non-releasable by the U.S. Fish and Wildlife Service due to lack of fur regrowth on her wounds. SeaWorld was then chosen to provide her with long-term care. ​

​Chilly has quickly adjusted to her new surroundings! She's been getting along with the other otters and her care team, all while showing off her playful personality. Be sure to say hi to Chilly next time you visit the park!

We're not LION, it's World Sea Lion Day! Here's 5 fast facts about California Sea Lions to celebrate:​

​1. Like other 'eared' seals, California sea lions have prominent external ear flaps. ​
2. Both pairs of flippers enable a sea lion to walk on land.​
3. Most sea lion pups are born in late June, and pups can open their eyes at birth. ​
4. They often form dense groups of a thousand or more animals on land. ​
5. Sea lions produce loud roars  - this explains why they're named after lions!​

​Be sure to say hello to these marvelous animals next time you visit the park!

King Size Season Pass Holders: 
- Don't forget to register for your First-To-Ride timeslot available May 29-31. 
- A date and time to enter the queue must be reserved in advance in your Self-Service account and cannot be changed or modified. 
- Log in to your Self-Service account - https://bit.ly/2ZCoxxP - and select the 'Redeemable Benefits' option on the homepage. You will then see multiple options for dates and times to ride once. 
- Only King Size Pass holders with a voucher can enter the queue - please have ready to scan. 
- You must be a Hershey bar or higher height category to ride. 
- Guests requiring accommodations must re-enroll in our Ride Accessibility Program for this coaster.  
- Get ready for thrills you can only find at Hersheypark!

Two of Happy Hollow's education ambassadors, Hermes and Apollo, are showing off what a ferret pile looks like 🤪 #DYK that a group of ferrets is called a 'business?' Silver Bells Arena is open for skating all day long, but the fun, weekly themes and games begin at 7pm until close. Come join in on the fun and win some prizes while you're at it!

What does Santa do during the summer? Come find out - we are open for the season! 

Please note that Santa's elves are diligently treating the Paratrooper ride in this video to a full refurbishment. This ride will reopen later this season and we can't wait to show it off once it's done!

Tunes in the Trees begins TONIGHT with the Summer of '69 (Bryan Adams Tribute) from 7pm-9pm! 🎶⁠
⁠
We're so excited for the return of our Friday summer concert series and look forward to kicking off the Memorial Day Holiday Weekend with everyone! We're also pleased to announce that local favorite, @lakearrowheadbrewing, is the official beer partner of Tunes in the Trees. A limited edition LABC x SPSV pub mug will be for sale on Fridays during the concerts only, so get one while supplies last. There's only 200 made, so they will go fast! 🍻⁠
⁠
Your first beer is included with the purchase of your pub mug ($18) and draft refills of your choice are only $9 each. Then, don't forget to bring your mug every time you visit SkyPark to receive your $9 refill as part of our Pub Mug Club*!

*For guests 21+. Must have mug present for all refills. Draft beers range $9-$14 normally without discount.

⁠
Tunes in the Trees is proudly sponsored by Mountain West Financial, Inc

Included with admission. Psssst… Season Passholders get early entry to select attractions at 10am 😉

Join us on May 27 for the official opening ceremony of Rescue Jr.! Enjoy a speech from Park President Jim Lake, an exciting live musical performance, ribbon cannons, and a ceremonial ribbon cutting!​

​After the ceremony, have tons of family-friendly fun exploring the Mini Rescue Training Zone play area, climbing to the top of the newly refurbished Rescue Boat in the center of the Rescue Bay Splash Zone, meeting animal conservation ambassadors and members of the SeaWorld Rescue team, getting a close-up look at real rescue vehicles, and so much more!​

The ceremony will begin at 10:15am, Rescue Jr. will open to the public immediately after.
Tag a friend who needs to experience this with you!🌊

Drop a line, stay awhile. 🎣

We're starting off the fly fishing season over at Dragonfly Pond within Meadowlands (by the last bridge)! Come learn how to fish and see what you might find with our instructors from 10am-4:15pm. Fishing equipment is free and included with a Day Pass or Passholder membership. Please note that a fishing license is required, per the California Department of Fish and Wildlife. If you already have one, bring it during your next visit or you can purchase a one-day fishing license in the Exit Shop. Catch and release only.

And stay tuned for updates on when Ladybug Pond will be open for fly fishing!

Os fãs do #PlaylandEldorado podem contar com uma grande novidade! 😁

Chegou um Novo Simulador de Corrida, de modelo inédito no Playland e repleto de recursos tecnológicos 😎

O público terá a chance de percorrer a pista de um circuito profissional de corrida, com muita emoção e aventura! E toda a experiência do simulador é ambientada dentro do jogo #AssettoCorsa, um dos mais famosos e conhecidos do mundo dos games! 🕹🏎

Gráficos de alta resolução, realismo em cada detalhe, recursos de tecnologia e MUITA DIVERSÃO te esperam no Playland Eldorado!
